title: White Wedding
descriptions:
White Wedding (1989) follows a tightly wound couple, Claire and David, as they race toward their meticulously planned nuptials over one chaotic weekend. Claire, a perfectionist with a brittle smile, has built her dream ceremony down to the ribbon colors; David, a gentle romantic, just wants everyone to get along. Their plans unravel when Claire’s outspoken sister arrives with a surprise plus-one—Claire’s impulsive ex, freshly sober and overflowing with apologies—and David’s estranged father shows up uninvited, hauling decades of resentment and a new, much younger fiancée.

As mishaps pile up—a ruined dress, a vanished ring, a florist strike, and a rehearsal dinner turned confession booth—the couple is forced to confront the truth beneath the lace and seating charts: Claire’s fear that love won’t last, David’s tendency to avoid conflict, and the families’ competing expectations about tradition, class, and control. Meanwhile, a wry best man and a fiercely loyal maid of honor attempt triage, shepherding the wedding party through absurd detours that deepen old wounds and spark unexpected camaraderie.

On the morning of the ceremony, a storm threatens to cancel everything, but the chaos clarifies what matters. Claire and David rewrite their vows on the back of a crumpled program, choose a simpler ceremony, and invite their fractured families to stand together. The result is imperfect, heartfelt, and honest—a white wedding stained by reality, transformed into something truly their own.
